saint-john-xxiii.name: Pope Saint John XXIII
saint-john-xxiii.history: Born Angelo Giuseppe Roncalli (1881–1963), Pope John XXIII served as Pope from 1958 until his death. He is widely remembered for convening the Second Vatican Council (Vatican II), a pivotal event that initiated significant reforms and a spirit of aggiornamento (updating) within the Catholic Church. Known as 'Good Pope John,' he emphasized pastoral care, peace, and ecumenical dialogue, and he issued important encyclicals like 'Pacem in Terris' (Peace on Earth).

saint-john-paul-ii.name: Pope Saint John Paul II
saint-john-paul-ii.history: Born Karol Józef Wojtyła (1920–2005), Pope John Paul II served as Pope from 1978 to 2005, making him one of the longest-serving pontiffs in history. He was a charismatic leader who played a crucial role in ending communist rule in his native Poland and eventually across Eastern Europe. He significantly impacted the Church through his extensive travels, strong moral teachings, emphasis on human dignity, and the establishment of World Youth Day. He canonized a record number of saints during his pontificate.
